1.Name: Schindler's List
1.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes, Ben Kingsley
1.Outline: In Poland during World War II, Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

2.Name: Airlift
2.Credit: Dir: Raja Menon With: Akshay Kumar, Nimrat Kaur, Taranjit Kaur
2.Outline: When Iraq invades Kuwait in August, 1990, a callous Indian businessman becomes the spokesperson for more than 170,000 stranded countrymen.

3.Name: The Message
3.Credit: Dir: Moustapha Akkad With: Anthony Quinn, Irene Papas, Michael Ansara
3.Outline: This must-see epic depicts the birth of Islam. In the 7th century Mohammed is visited by Angel Gabriel...

4.Name: Braveheart
4.Credit: Dir: Mel Gibson With: Mel Gibson, Sophie Marceau, Patrick McGoohan
4.Outline: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.

5.Name: Rang De Basanti
5.Credit: Dir: Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra With: Aamir Khan, Soha Ali Khan, Siddharth
5.Outline: The story of six young Indians who assist an English Woman to film a documentary on the extremist freedom fighters from their past, and the events that lead them to relive the long forgotten saga of freedom.

6.Name: Lawrence of Arabia
6.Credit: Dir: David Lean With: Peter O'Toole, Alec Guinness, Anthony Quinn
6.Outline: Follows a brilliant, flamboyant and controversial British military figure and his conflicted loyalties during wartime service.

7.Name: Amadeus
7.Credit: Dir: Milos Forman With: F. Murray Abraham, Tom Hulce, Elizabeth Berridge
7.Outline: The incredible story of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, told by his peer and secret rival Antonio Salieri - now confined to an insane asylum.

8.Name: Bhaag Milkha Bhaag
8.Credit: Dir: Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra With: Farhan Akhtar, Sonam Kapoor, Pavan Malhotra
8.Outline: The truth behind the ascension of Milkha "The Flying Sikh" Singh who was scarred because of the India-Pakistan partition.

9.Name: Downfall
9.Credit: Dir: Oliver Hirschbiegel With: Bruno Ganz, Alexandra Maria Lara, Ulrich Matthes
9.Outline: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

10.Name: The Great Escape
10.Credit: Dir: John Sturges With: Steve McQueen, James Garner, Richard Attenborough
10.Outline: Allied P.O.W.s plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

11.Name: Gone with the Wind
11.Credit: Dir: Victor Fleming With: Clark Gable, Vivien Leigh, Thomas Mitchell
11.Outline: A manipulative Southern belle carries on a turbulent affair with a blockade runner during the American Civil War.

12.Name: Spotlight
12.Credit: Dir: Tom McCarthy With: Mark Ruffalo, Michael Keaton, Rachel McAdams
12.Outline: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

13.Name: Hotel Rwanda
13.Credit: Dir: Terry George With: Don Cheadle, Sophie Okonedo, Joaquin Phoenix
13.Outline: The true story of Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager who housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda.

14.Name: In the Name of the Father
14.Credit: Dir: Jim Sheridan With: Daniel Day-Lewis, Pete Postlethwaite, Alison Crosbie
14.Outline: A man's coerced confession to an IRA bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. An English lawyer fights to free them.

15.Name: 12 Years a Slave
15.Credit: Dir: Steve McQueen With: Chiwetel Ejiofor, Michael Kenneth Williams, Michael Fassbender
15.Outline: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup , a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

16.Name: Gandhi
16.Credit: Dir: Richard Attenborough With: Ben Kingsley, John Gielgud, Candice Bergen
16.Outline: Gandhi's character is fully explained as a man of nonviolence. Through his patience, he is able to drive the British out of the subcontinent. And the stubborn nature of Jinnah and his commitment towards Pakistan is portrayed.

17.Name: Barry Lyndon
17.Credit: Dir: Stanley Kubrick With: Ryan O'Neal, Marisa Berenson, Patrick Magee
17.Outline: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

18.Name: The King's Speech
18.Credit: Dir: Tom Hooper With: Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter
18.Outline: The story of King George VI of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, his impromptu ascension to the throne and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch become worthy of it.

19.Name: Special 26
19.Credit: Dir: Neeraj Pandey With: Anupam Kher, Manoj Bajpayee, Akshay Kumar
19.Outline: A gang of con-men rob prominent rich businessmen and politicians by posing as C.B.I and income tax officers.

20.Name: JFK
20.Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Kevin Costner, Gary Oldman, Jack Lemmon
20.Outline: A New Orleans DA discovers there's more to the Kennedy assassination than the official story.

21.Name: Aguirre, the Wrath of God
21.Credit: Dir: Werner Herzog With: Klaus Kinski, Ruy Guerra, Helena Rojo
21.Outline: In the 16th century, the ruthless and insane Don Lope de Aguirre leads a Spanish expedition in search of El Dorado.

22.Name: All the President's Men
22.Credit: Dir: Alan J. Pakula With: Dustin Hoffman, Robert Redford, Jack Warden
22.Outline: "The Washington Post" reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein uncover the details of the Watergate scandal that leads to President Richard Nixon 's resignation.

23.Name: Battleship Potemkin
23.Credit: Dir: Sergei M. Eisenstein With: Aleksandr Antonov, Vladimir Barsky, Grigori Aleksandrov
23.Outline: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resulting street demonstration which brought on a police massacre.

24.Name: Straight Outta Compton
24.Credit: Dir: F. Gary Gray With: O'Shea Jackson Jr., Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell
24.Outline: The group NWA emerges from the mean streets of Compton in Los Angeles, California, in the mid-1980s and revolutionizes Hip Hop culture with their music and tales about life in the hood.

25.Name: Spartacus
25.Credit: Dir: Stanley Kubrick With: Kirk Douglas, Laurence Olivier, Jean Simmons
25.Outline: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

26.Name: Letters from Iwo Jima
26.Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Ken Watanabe, Kazunari Ninomiya, Tsuyoshi Ihara
26.Outline: The story of the battle of Iwo Jima between the United States and Imperial Japan during World War II, as told from the perspective of the Japanese who fought it.

27.Name: Hero
27.Credit: Dir: Yimou Zhang With: Jet Li, Tony Chiu Wai Leung, Maggie Cheung
27.Outline: A defense officer, Nameless, was summoned by the King of Qin regarding his success of terminating three warriors.

28.Name: Glory
28.Credit: Dir: Edward Zwick With: Matthew Broderick, Denzel Washington, Cary Elwes
28.Outline: Robert Gould Shaw leads the US Civil War's first all-black volunteer company, fighting prejudices of both his own Union army and the Confederates.

29.Name: The Killing Fields
29.Credit: Dir: Roland JoffÃ© With: Sam Waterston, Haing S. Ngor, John Malkovich
29.Outline: A photographer is trapped in Cambodia during tyrant Pol Pot's bloody "Year Zero" cleansing campaign, which claimed the lives of two million "undesirable" civilians.

30.Name: The Right Stuff
30.Credit: Dir: Philip Kaufman With: Sam Shepard, Scott Glenn, Ed Harris
30.Outline: The story of the original Mercury 7 astronauts and their macho, seat-of-the-pants approach to the space program.

31.Name: The Ten Commandments
31.Credit: Dir: Cecil B. DeMille With: Charlton Heston, Yul Brynner, Anne Baxter
31.Outline: The Egyptian Prince, Moses, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.

32.Name: Tombstone
32.Genre: Action | Biography | Drama | History | Romance | Western
32.Credit: Dir: George P. Cosmatos With: Kurt Russell, Val Kilmer, Sam Elliott
32.Outline: A successful lawman's plans to retire anonymously in Tombstone, Arizona, are disrupted by the kind of outlaws he was famous for eliminating.

33.Name: Empire of the Sun
33.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Christian Bale, John Malkovich, Miranda Richardson
33.Outline: A young English boy struggles to survive under Japanese occupation during World War II.

34.Name: Zulu
34.Credit: Dir: Cy Endfield With: Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson
34.Outline: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

35.Name: The Longest Day
35.Credit: Dir: Ken Annakin, Andrew Marton With: John Wayne, Robert Ryan, Richard Burton
35.Outline: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

36.Name: The Last Emperor
36.Credit: Dir: Bernardo Bertolucci With: John Lone, Joan Chen, Peter O'Toole
36.Outline: The story of the final Emperor of China.

37.Name: Pride
37.Credit: Dir: Matthew Warchus With: Bill Nighy, Imelda Staunton, Dominic West
37.Outline: U.K. gay activists work to help miners during their lengthy strike of the National Union of Mineworkers in the summer of 1984.

38.Name: Argo
38.Credit: Dir: Ben Affleck With: Ben Affleck, Bryan Cranston, John Goodman
38.Outline: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1980.

39.Name: Black Hawk Down
39.Credit: Dir: Ridley Scott With: Josh Hartnett, Ewan McGregor, Tom Sizemore
39.Outline: 123 elite U.S. soldiers drop into Somalia to capture two top lieutenants of a renegade warlord and find themselves in a desperate battle with a large force of heavily-armed Somalis.

40.Name: The Last Samurai
40.Credit: Dir: Edward Zwick With: Tom Cruise, Ken Watanabe, Billy Connolly
40.Outline: An American military advisor embraces the Samurai culture he was hired to destroy after he is captured in battle.

41.Name: Malcolm X
41.Credit: Dir: Spike Lee With: Denzel Washington, Angela Bassett, Delroy Lindo
41.Outline: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.

42.Name: The Last King of Scotland
42.Credit: Dir: Kevin Macdonald With: James McAvoy, Forest Whitaker, Gillian Anderson
42.Outline: Based on the events of the brutal Ugandan dictator Idi Amin's regime as seen by his personal physician during the 1970s

43.Name: Frost/Nixon
43.Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Frank Langella, Michael Sheen, Kevin Bacon
43.Outline: A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon.

44.Name: Zodiac
44.Credit: Dir: David Fincher With: Jake Gyllenhaal, Robert Downey Jr., Mark Ruffalo
44.Outline: A San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac killer.

45.Name: Bridge of Spies
45.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Tom Hanks, Mark Rylance, Alan Alda
45.Outline: During the Cold War, an American lawyer is recruited to defend an arrested Soviet spy in court, and then help the CIA facilitate an exchange of the spy for the Soviet captured American U2 spy plane pilot, Francis Gary Powers.

46.Name: The Flowers of War
46.Credit: Dir: Yimou Zhang With: Christian Bale, Ni Ni, Xinyi Zhang
46.Outline: A Westerner finds refuge with a group of women in a church during Japan's rape of Nanking in 1937. Posing as a priest, he attempts to lead the women to safety.

47.Name: United 93
47.Credit: Dir: Paul Greengrass With: David Alan Basche, Olivia Thirlby, Liza ColÃ³n-Zayas
47.Outline: A real-time account of the events on United Flight 93, one of the planes hijacked on September eleventh, 2001, that crashed near Shanksville, Pennsylvania when passengers foiled the terrorist plot.

48.Name: Milk
48.Credit: Dir: Gus Van Sant With: Sean Penn, Josh Brolin, Emile Hirsch
48.Outline: The story of Harvey Milk , and his struggles as an American gay activist who fought for gay rights and became California's first openly gay elected official.

49.Name: Munich
49.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Eric Bana, Daniel Craig, Marie-JosÃ©e Croze
49.Outline: Based on the true story of the Black September aftermath, about the five men chosen to eliminate the ones responsible for that fateful day.

50.Name: Apollo 13
50.Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Tom Hanks, Bill Paxton, Kevin Bacon
50.Outline: NASA must devise a strategy to return Apollo 13 to Earth safely after the spacecraft undergoes massive internal damage putting the lives of the three astronauts on board in jeopardy.

51.Name: The Hurt Locker
51.Credit: Dir: Kathryn Bigelow With: Jeremy Renner, Anthony Mackie, Brian Geraghty
51.Outline: During the Iraq War, a Sergeant recently assigned to an army bomb squad is put at odds with his squad mates due to his maverick way of handling his work.

52.Name: A Royal Affair
52.Credit: Dir: Nikolaj Arcel With: Alicia Vikander, Mads Mikkelsen, Mikkel Boe FÃ¸lsgaard
52.Outline: A young queen, who is married to an insane king, falls secretly in love with her physician - and together they start a revolution that changes a nation forever.

53.Name: Enemy at the Gates
53.Credit: Dir: Jean-Jacques Annaud With: Jude Law, Ed Harris, Joseph Fiennes
53.Outline: A Russian and a German sniper play a game of cat-and-mouse during the Battle of Stalingrad.

54.Name: Ip Man 2
54.Credit: Dir: Wilson Yip With: Donnie Yen, Xiaoming Huang, Sammo Kam-Bo Hung
54.Outline: Centering on Ip Man's migration to Hong Kong in 1949 as he attempts to propagate his discipline of Wing Chun martial arts.

55.Name: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
55.Credit: Dir: Andrew Dominik With: Brad Pitt, Casey Affleck, Sam Shepard
55.Outline: Robert Ford, who's idolized Jesse James since childhood, tries hard to join the reforming gang of the Missouri outlaw, but gradually becomes resentful of the bandit leader.

56.Name: Gangs of New York
56.Credit: Dir: Martin Scorsese With: Leonardo DiCaprio, Cameron Diaz, Daniel Day-Lewis
56.Outline: In 1863, Amsterdam Vallon returns to the Five Points area of New York City seeking revenge against Bill the Butcher, his father's killer.

57.Name: The Wind That Shakes the Barley
57.Credit: Dir: Ken Loach With: Cillian Murphy, Padraic Delaney, Liam Cunningham
57.Outline: Against the backdrop of the Irish War of Independence, two brothers fight a guerrilla war against British forces.

58.Name: Good Night, and Good Luck.
58.Credit: Dir: George Clooney With: David Strathairn, George Clooney, Patricia Clarkson
58.Outline: Broadcast journalist Edward R. Murrow looks to bring down Senator Joseph McCarthy .

59.Name: Elizabeth
59.Credit: Dir: Shekhar Kapur With: Cate Blanchett, Geoffrey Rush, Christopher Eccleston
59.Outline: A film of the early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

60.Name: Quiz Show
60.Credit: Dir: Robert Redford With: Ralph Fiennes, John Turturro, Rob Morrow
60.Outline: A young lawyer, Richard Goodwin, investigates a potentially fixed game show. Charles Van Doren, a big time show winner, is under Goodwin's investigation.

61.Name: Saving Mr. Banks
61.Credit: Dir: John Lee Hancock With: Emma Thompson, Tom Hanks, Annie Rose Buckley
61.Outline: Author P.L. Travers reflects on her childhood after reluctantly meeting with Walt Disney , who seeks to adapt her Mary Poppins books for the big screen.

62.Name: Miracle
62.Credit: Dir: Gavin O'Connor With: Kurt Russell, Patricia Clarkson, Nathan West
62.Outline: Miracle tells the true story of Herb Brooks (Russell), the player-turned-coach who led the 1980 U.S. Olympic hockey team to victory over the seemingly invincible Russian squad.

63.Name: Gallipoli
63.Credit: Dir: Peter Weir With: Mel Gibson, Mark Lee, Bill Kerr
63.Outline: Two Australian sprinters face the brutal realities of war when they are sent to fight in the Gallipoli campaign in Turkey during World War I.

64.Name: Selma
64.Credit: Dir: Ava DuVernay With: David Oyelowo, Carmen Ejogo, Tim Roth
64.Outline: A chronicle of Martin Luther King 's campaign to secure equal voting rights via an epic march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama in 1965.

65.Name: The Mission
65.Credit: Dir: Roland JoffÃ© With: Robert De Niro, Jeremy Irons, Ray McAnally
65.Outline: 18th century Spanish Jesuits try to protect a remote South American Indian tribe in danger of falling under the rule of pro-slavery Portugal.

66.Name: Les Misérables
66.Credit: Dir: Bille August With: Liam Neeson, Geoffrey Rush, Uma Thurman
66.Outline: Jean Valjean, a Frenchman imprisoned for stealing bread, must flee a police officer named Javert. The pursuit consumes both men's lives...

67.Name: A Bridge Too Far
67.Credit: Dir: Richard Attenborough With: Sean Connery, Ryan O'Neal, Michael Caine
67.Outline: Operation Market Garden, September 1944: The Allies attempt to capture several strategically important bridges in the Netherlands in the hope of breaking the German lines. However, mismanagement and poor planning result in its failure.

68.Name: Zero Dark Thirty
68.Credit: Dir: Kathryn Bigelow With: Jessica Chastain, Joel Edgerton, Chris Pratt
68.Outline: A chronicle of the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks, and his death at the hands of the Navy S.E.A.L.s Team 6 in May 2011.

69.Name: Red Cliff
69.Credit: Dir: John Woo With: Tony Chiu Wai Leung, Takeshi Kaneshiro, Fengyi Zhang
69.Outline: The first chapter of a two-part story centered on a battle fought in China's Three Kingdoms period (220-280 A.D.).

70.Name: Lincoln
70.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, David Strathairn
70.Outline: As the Civil War continues to rage, America's president struggles with continuing carnage on the battlefield as he fights with many inside his own cabinet on the decision to emancipate the slaves.

71.Name: Conquest 1453
71.Credit: Dir: Faruk Aksoy With: Devrim Evin, Ibrahim Celikkol, Dilek Serbest
71.Outline: After the death of his father Murat II, Mehmet II ascends to the Ottoman throne. After braving internal and external enemies, he decides to complete what he was destined to do - conquer Constantinople.

72.Name: Invictus
72.Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Morgan Freeman, Matt Damon, Tony Kgoroge
72.Outline: Nelson Mandela, in his first term as the South African President, initiates a unique venture to unite the apartheid-torn land: enlist the national rugby team on a mission to win the 1995 Rugby World Cup.

73.Name: The Way Back
73.Credit: Dir: Peter Weir With: Jim Sturgess, Ed Harris, Colin Farrell
73.Outline: Siberian gulag escapees travel 4,000 miles by foot to freedom in India.

74.Name: Woman in Gold
74.Credit: Dir: Simon Curtis With: Helen Mirren, Ryan Reynolds, Daniel BrÃ¼hl
74.Outline: Maria Altmann, an octogenarian Jewish refugee, takes on the Austrian government to recover artwork she believes rightfully belongs to her family.

75.Name: Seabiscuit
75.Credit: Dir: Gary Ross With: Tobey Maguire, Jeff Bridges, Elizabeth Banks
75.Outline: True story of the undersized Depression-era racehorse whose victories lifted not only the spirits of the team behind it but also those of their nation.

76.Name: The Young Victoria
76.Credit: Dir: Jean-Marc VallÃ©e With: Emily Blunt, Rupert Friend, Paul Bettany
76.Outline: A dramatization of the turbulent first years of Queen Victoria's rule, and her enduring romance with Prince Albert.

77.Name: American Sniper
77.Genre: Action | Biography | Drama | History | Thriller | War
77.Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller, Kyle Gallner
77.Outline: Navy S.E.A.L. sniper Chris Kyle's pinpoint accuracy saves countless lives on the battlefield and turns him into a legend. Back home to his wife and kids after four tours of duty, however, Chris finds that it is the war he can't leave behind.

78.Name: Thirteen Days
78.Credit: Dir: Roger Donaldson With: Kevin Costner, Bruce Greenwood, Shawn Driscoll
78.Outline: A dramatization of the Kennedy administration's struggle to contain the Cuban Missile Crisis in October 1962.

79.Name: Mongol: The Rise of Genghis Khan
79.Credit: Dir: Sergey Bodrov With: Tadanobu Asano, Amadu Mamadakov, Khulan Chuluun
79.Outline: The story recounts the early life of Genghis Khan who was a slave before going on to conquer half the world including Russia in 1206.

80.Name: Amistad
80.Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Djimon Hounsou, Matthew McConaughey, Anthony Hopkins
80.Outline: About a 1839 mutiny aboard a slave ship that is traveling towards the northeastern coast of America. Much of the story involves a court-room drama about the free man who led the revolt.

81.Name: Kon-Tiki
81.Credit: Dir: Joachim RÃ¸nning, Espen Sandberg With: PÃ¥l Sverre Hagen, Anders Baasmo Christiansen, Gustaf SkarsgÃ¥rd
81.Outline: Legendary explorer Thor Heyerdal's epic 4,300-mile crossing of the Pacific on a balsawood raft in 1947, in an effort to prove that it was possible for South Americans to settle in Polynesia in pre-Columbian times.

82.Name: Shattered Glass
82.Credit: Dir: Billy Ray With: Hayden Christensen, ChloÃ« Sevigny, Steve Zahn
82.Outline: The true story of a young journalist who fell from grace when it was found he had fabricated over half of his articles.

83.Name: Kingdom of Heaven
83.Credit: Dir: Ridley Scott With: Orlando Bloom, Eva Green, Liam Neeson
83.Outline: Balian of Ibelin travels to Jerusalem during the crusades of the 12th century, and there he finds himself as the defender of the city and its people.

84.Name: Cold Mountain
84.Credit: Dir: Anthony Minghella With: Jude Law, Nicole Kidman, RenÃ©e Zellweger
84.Outline: In the waning days of the American Civil War, a wounded soldier embarks on a perilous journey back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart.

85.Name: Che: Part One
85.Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: Julia Ormond, Benicio Del Toro, Oscar Isaac
85.Outline: In 1956, Ernesto 'Che' Guevara and a band of Castro-led Cuban exiles mobilize an army to topple the regime of dictator Fulgencio Batista.

86.Name: Agora
86.Credit: Dir: Alejandro AmenÃ¡bar With: Rachel Weisz, Max Minghella, Oscar Isaac
86.Outline: A historical drama set in Roman Egypt, concerning a slave who turns to the rising tide of Christianity in the hope of pursuing freedom while falling in love with his mistress, the famous philosophy and mathematics professor Hypatia of Alexandria.

87.Name: Defiance
87.Credit: Dir: Edward Zwick With: Daniel Craig, Liev Schreiber, Jamie Bell
87.Outline: Jewish brothers in Nazi-occupied Eastern Europe escape into the Belarussian forests, where they join Russian resistance fighters and endeavor to build a village in order to protect themselves and about 1,000 Jewish non-combatants.

88.Name: We Were Soldiers
88.Credit: Dir: Randall Wallace With: Mel Gibson, Madeleine Stowe, Greg Kinnear
88.Outline: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War and the soldiers on both sides that fought it.

89.Name: The Legend Is Born: Ip Man
89.Credit: Dir: Herman Yau With: Yu-Hang To, Yi Huang, Biao Yuen
89.Outline: Yip Man's resistance against invading foreigners, along with his romantic relations while under the tutelage of three Wing Chun masters.

90.Name: The Patriot
90.Credit: Dir: Roland Emmerich With: Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson
90.Outline: Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.

91.Name: Charlie Wilson's War
91.Credit: Dir: Mike Nichols With: Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts, Philip Seymour Hoffman
91.Outline: A drama based on a Texas congressman Charlie Wilson's covert dealings in Afghanistan, where his efforts to assist rebels in their war with the Soviets have some unforeseen and long-reaching effects.

92.Name: Everest
92.Credit: Dir: Baltasar KormÃ¡kur With: Jason Clarke, Ang Phula Sherpa, Thomas M. Wright
92.Outline: A climbing expedition on Mt. Everest is devastated by a severe snow storm.

93.Name: Flags of Our Fathers
93.Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Ryan Phillippe, Barry Pepper, Joseph Cross
93.Outline: The life stories of the six men who raised the flag at The Battle of Iwo Jima, a turning point in WWII.

94.Name: Balto
94.Credit: Dir: Simon Wells With: Kevin Bacon, Bob Hoskins, Bridget Fonda
94.Outline: An outcast half-wolf risks his life to prevent a deadly epidemic from ravaging Nome, Alaska.

95.Name: Bobby
95.Credit: Dir: Emilio Estevez With: Anthony Hopkins, Demi Moore, Sharon Stone
95.Outline: The story of the assassination of U.S. Senator Robert F. Kennedy who was shot in the early morning hours of June 5, 1968 in the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles, and 22 people in the hotel whose lives were never the same.

96.Name: Breach
96.Credit: Dir: Billy Ray With: Chris Cooper, Ryan Phillippe, Dennis Haysbert
96.Outline: FBI upstart Eric O'Neill enters into a power game with his boss, Robert Hanssen, an agent who was put on trial for selling secrets to the Soviet Union.

97.Name: Seven Years in Tibet
97.Credit: Dir: Jean-Jacques Annaud With: Brad Pitt, David Thewlis, BD Wong
97.Outline: True story of Heinrich Harrer, an Austrian mountain climber who became friends with the Dalai Lama at the time of China's takeover of Tibet.

98.Name: Legend
98.Credit: Dir: Brian Helgeland With: Tom Hardy, Emily Browning, Taron Egerton
98.Outline: The film tells the story of the identical twin gangsters Reggie and Ronnie Kray, two of the most notorious criminals in British history, and their organised crime empire in the East End of London during the 1960s.

99.Name: Public Enemies
99.Credit: Dir: Michael Mann With: Christian Bale, Johnny Depp, David Wenham
99.Outline: The Feds try to take down notorious American gangsters John Dillinger, Baby Face Nelson and Pretty Boy Floyd during a booming crime wave in the 1930s.

100.Name: In the Heart of the Sea
100.Genre: Action | Adventure | Biography | Drama | History | Thriller
100.Credit: Dir: Ron Howard With: Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy, Brendan Gleeson
100.Outline: A recounting of a New England whaling ship's sinking by a giant whale in 1820, an experience that later inspired the great novel Moby-Dick.

101.Name: Anonymous
101.Credit: Dir: Roland Emmerich With: Rhys Ifans, Vanessa Redgrave, David Thewlis
101.Outline: The theory that it was in fact Edward De Vere, Earl of Oxford, who penned Shakespeare's plays. Set against the backdrop of the succession of Queen Elizabeth I and the Essex rebellion against her.

102.Name: The Duchess
102.Credit: Dir: Saul Dibb With: Keira Knightley, Ralph Fiennes, Dominic Cooper
102.Outline: A chronicle of the life of 18th century aristocrat Georgiana, Duchess of Devonshire, who was reviled for her extravagant political and personal life.

103.Name: Che: Part Two
103.Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: DemiÃ¡n Bichir, Rodrigo Santoro, Benicio Del Toro
103.Outline: In 1967, Ernesto 'Che' Guevara leads a small partisan army to fight an ill-fated revolutionary guerrilla war in Bolivia, South America.

104.Name: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
104.Credit: Dir: Shekhar Kapur With: Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush
104.Outline: A mature Queen Elizabeth endures multiple crises late in her reign including court intrigues, an assassination plot, the Spanish Armada, and romantic disappointments.

105.Name: The Crucible
105.Credit: Dir: Nicholas Hytner With: Daniel Day-Lewis, Winona Ryder, Paul Scofield
105.Outline: A Salem resident attempts to frame her ex-lover's wife for being a witch in the middle of the 1692 witchcraft trials.

106.Name: The Other Boleyn Girl
106.Credit: Dir: Justin Chadwick With: Natalie Portman, Scarlett Johansson, Eric Bana
106.Outline: Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII.

107.Name: The Good Shepherd
107.Credit: Dir: Robert De Niro With: Matt Damon, Angelina Jolie, Robert De Niro
107.Outline: The tumultuous early history of the Central Intelligence Agency is viewed through the prism of one man's life.

108.Name: The New World
108.Credit: Dir: Terrence Malick With: Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christopher Plummer
108.Outline: The story of the English exploration of Virginia, and of the changing world and loves of Pocahontas.

109.Name: Anna and the King
109.Credit: Dir: Andy Tennant With: Jodie Foster, Yun-Fat Chow, Bai Ling
109.Outline: The story of the romance between the King of Siam and widowed British schoolteacher, Anna Leonowens, during the 1860s.

110.Name: Robin Hood
110.Credit: Dir: Ridley Scott With: Russell Crowe, Cate Blanchett, Matthew Macfadyen
110.Outline: In 12th century England, Robin and his band of marauders confront corruption in a local village and lead an uprising against the crown that will forever alter the balance of world power.

111.Name: K-19: The Widowmaker
111.Credit: Dir: Kathryn Bigelow With: Harrison Ford, Sam Spruell, Peter Stebbings
111.Outline: When Russia's first nuclear submarine malfunctions on its maiden voyage, the crew must race to save the ship and prevent a nuclear disaster.

112.Name: Pocahontas
112.Genre: Animation | Adventure | Drama | Family | History | Musical | Romance
112.Credit: Dir: Mike Gabriel, Eric Goldberg With: Mel Gibson, Linda Hunt, Christian Bale
112.Outline: An English soldier and the daughter of an Algonquin chief share a romance when English colonists invade seventeenth-century Virginia.

113.Name: The 13th Warrior
113.Credit: Dir: John McTiernan With: Antonio Banderas, Diane Venora, Dennis StorhÃ¸i
113.Outline: A man, having fallen in love with the wrong woman, is sent by the sultan himself on a diplomatic mission to a distant land as an ambassador. Stopping at a Viking village port to restock on supplies, he finds himself unwittingly embroiled on a quest to banish a mysterious threat in a distant Viking land.

114.Name: Flyboys
114.Genre: Action | Adventure | Drama | History | Romance | War
114.Credit: Dir: Tony Bill With: James Franco, Jean Reno, Jennifer Decker
114.Outline: The adventures of the Lafayette Escadrille, young Americans who volunteered for the French military before the U.S. entered World War I, and became the country's first fighter pilots.

115.Name: Hollywoodland
115.Genre: Biography | Crime | Drama | History | Mystery | Romance | Thriller
115.Credit: Dir: Allen Coulter With: Adrien Brody, Ben Affleck, Diane Lane
115.Outline: A detective examines the mysterious death of George Reeves , the star of the television series Adventures of Superman .

116.Name: Marie Antoinette
116.Credit: Dir: Sofia Coppola With: Kirsten Dunst, Jason Schwartzman, Rip Torn
116.Outline: The retelling of France's iconic but ill-fated queen, Marie Antoinette. From her betrothal and marriage to Louis XVI at 15 to her reign as queen at 19 and to the end of her reign as queen and ultimately the fall of Versailles.

117.Name: The Iron Lady
117.Credit: Dir: Phyllida Lloyd With: Meryl Streep, Jim Broadbent, Richard E. Grant
117.Outline: An elderly Margaret Thatcher talks to the imagined presence of her recently deceased husband as she struggles to come to terms with his death while scenes from her past life, from girlhood to British prime minister, intervene.

118.Name: The Messenger: The Story of Joan of Arc
118.Credit: Dir: Luc Besson With: Milla Jovovich, John Malkovich, Rab Affleck
118.Outline: A young girl receives a vision that drives her to rid France of its oppressors.

119.Name: Black Death
119.Genre: Action | Adventure | Drama | History | Horror | Mystery
119.Credit: Dir: Christopher Smith With: Eddie Redmayne, Sean Bean, Carice van Houten
119.Outline: Set during the time of the first outbreak of bubonic plague in England, a young monk is given the task of learning the truth about reports of people being brought back to life in a small village.

120.Name: Centurion
120.Genre: Action | Adventure | Drama | History | Thriller | War
120.Credit: Dir: Neil Marshall With: Michael Fassbender, Dominic West, Olga Kurylenko
120.Outline: A splinter group of Roman soldiers fight for their lives behind enemy lines after their legion is decimated in a devastating guerrilla attack.

121.Name: W.
121.Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Josh Brolin, Elizabeth Banks, Ioan Gruffudd
121.Outline: A chronicle of the life and presidency of George W. Bush .

122.Name: Evita
122.Credit: Dir: Alan Parker With: Madonna, Jonathan Pryce, Antonio Banderas
122.Outline: The hit musical based on the life of Evita Duarte, a B-picture Argentinian actress who eventually became the wife of Argentinian president Juan PerÃ³n, and the most beloved and hated woman in Argentina.

123.Name: King Arthur
123.Credit: Dir: Antoine Fuqua With: Clive Owen, Stephen Dillane, Keira Knightley
123.Outline: A demystified take on the tale of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table.

124.Name: The Eagle
124.Credit: Dir: Kevin Macdonald With: Channing Tatum, Jamie Bell, Donald Sutherland
124.Outline: In Roman-ruled Britain, a young Roman soldier endeavors to honor his father's memory by finding his lost legion's golden emblem.

125.Name: Ironclad
125.Credit: Dir: Jonathan English With: Paul Giamatti, Jason Flemyng, Brian Cox
125.Outline: In 13th-century England, a small group of Knights Templar fight to defend Rochester Castle against the tyrannical King John.

126.Name: Pearl Harbor
126.Credit: Dir: Michael Bay With: Ben Affleck, Kate Beckinsale, Josh Hartnett
126.Outline: Pearl Harbor follows the story of two best friends, Rafe and Danny, and their love lives as they go off to join the war.

127.Name: World Trade Center
127.Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Nicolas Cage, Michael PeÃ±a, Maria Bello
127.Outline: Two Port Authority police officers become trapped under the rubble of the World Trade Center.

128.Name: Red Tails
128.Credit: Dir: Anthony Hemingway With: Cuba Gooding Jr., Gerald McRaney, David Oyelowo
128.Outline: A crew of African American pilots in the Tuskegee training program, having faced segregation while kept mostly on the ground during World War II, are called into duty under the guidance of Col. A.J. Bullard.

129.Name: Pompeii
129.Credit: Dir: Paul W.S. Anderson With: Kit Harington, Emily Browning, Kiefer Sutherland
129.Outline: A slave-turned-gladiator finds himself in a race against time to save his true love, who has been betrothed to a corrupt Roman Senator. As Mount Vesuvius erupts, he must fight to save his beloved as Pompeii crumbles around him.

130.Name: Alexander
130.Genre: Action | Adventure | Biography | Drama | History | Romance | War
130.Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Colin Farrell, Anthony Hopkins, Rosario Dawson
130.Outline: Alexander, the King of Macedonia and one of the greatest military leaders in the history of warfare, conquers much of the known world.

131.Name: Caligula
131.Credit: Dir: Tinto Brass With: Malcolm McDowell, Peter O'Toole, Helen Mirren
131.Outline: Details the graphic and shocking, yet undeniably tragic story of Rome's most infamous Caesar, Gaius Germanicus Caligula.

132.Name: 10,000 BC
132.Credit: Dir: Roland Emmerich With: Camilla Belle, Steven Strait, Marco Khan
132.Outline: A prehistoric epic that follows a young mammoth hunter's journey through uncharted territory to secure the future of his tribe.
